title: Pausing Foreign Corrupt Practices Act Enforcement To Further American Economic and National Security
summary: This executive order pauses enforcement of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, which prohibits American companies and individuals from bribing foreign officials. The stated goal is to further American economic and national security interests by relaxing these anti-corruption regulations.
full_text: For universities like Yale, this order could potentially open the door for increased foreign investment and partnerships, but it also raises ethical concerns and risks of financial misconduct that could negatively impact their finances and reputation.
